DOC.brief_summary: An increase of the free fraction may allow a better removal of of protein-bound uremic toxins during dialysis. During predilution hemodiafiltration, the sodium chloride (NaCl) concentration will be increased in the infusion fluid at a target NaCl concentration and the effect on the removal of protein-bound toxins will be determined. Comparisons will be made to standard hemodialysis and hemodiafiltration.
DOC.brief_title: Sodium Chloride and Protein-Bound Toxin Removal in Hemodiafiltration
DOC.criteria: Endstage renal disease Maintenance hemodialysis or hemodiafiltration for more than 3 months Stable clinical condition > 18 years Life expectancy less than 1 year Pregnancy Active infectious disease
